definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Defensibility is also taken into consideration when settling an area.
sentences.chinese: 定居地区还必须考虑到其防御性。

sentences.english: China fought a defensive war with resoluteness and on its own initiative.
sentences.chinese: 中国参战其性质属于果断与主动的防御性参战。

sentences.english: Callie and Thunder both have roughly the same degree of defense drive.
sentences.chinese: 佳丽和雷电大致拥有同样程度的防御性驱力。

sentences.english: The defensive necessity is to counter-attack the danger source.
sentences.chinese: 防御性紧急避险是针对危险源本身所实施的避险。

sentences.english: Phenolic glycosides were main defense chemicals for Salicaceae.
sentences.chinese: 酚甙类物质是杨柳科植物体内最重要的防御性物质。

definition: Buddha's teaching/Buddhist monk's apparel, staff etc/(Daoism) magic weapon/talisman/fig. specially effective device/magic wand
shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to take countermeasures against/to hit back/to counter
to flee from danger/to avoid danger/to minimize risk/(finance) hedge
